description: A community-run evening of talks and discussions on the future development of Convoys Wharf. The historically important 40 acre site is slated for a controversial large-scale re-development. A must for all concerned about London's future.

factsheet.heading: Community Activism
paragraphs: Voice for Deptford is a voluntary community group, actively campaigning for a better and inclusive development at Deptford Dockyard/Convoy's Wharf, that all can celebrate.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: The convoys wharf site is rich in history, being home to a Royal Dockyard, much of which was recently excavated and still present.

The site was also home to the gardens of Sayes Court, home to John Evelyn, one of the founders of the Royal Society. The garden was instrumental to the development of the English Landscape tradition, and later on to the development of the National Trust.

images.title: MOLA guide to Convoy's Wharf Archaeology

location.address: Armada Centre, Armada Court, 21 McMillan St
travel_info: Tube: New Cross Gate, Deptford Bridge, Surrey Quays

name: Public Meeting: Time for Change: A New Vision for Convoys Wharf
